segments.text: Peeking into the kitchen, I spot the overflow first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink's full, water pouring over the edge non-stop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's drying a plate, back turned to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's on, but she's stepping in the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if she slips on that wet floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are on the other side, up to something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy's on a stool that's about to topple.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching into the cookie jar, so high up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's below, arm extended eagerly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This could end in tears if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a calm garden, totally opposite.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's noticing the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are dripping now too.
segments.speaker: PAR
